embeds.title: Compile Package
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Choose one of three  (**Upgrade**d) **Packages** to gain.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: this is so versatile
what if we made dead branch a 0 cost card

this has so many options that its virtually guaranteed to make your turn good whenever you see this card. The fact that you get to choose 3 out of 9 cards puts discovery to shame. This also has an obscenely high value upgrade; nearly doubling this cards effectiveness.
simply a super broken card; if it was not for gem cannon this would be the best guardian rare.
this card is so good you should even take it if you have snecko eye, despite it being a 0 cost...
Yeah this should have a price increase, it's essentially a 0 cost "draw 3 cards but pick what 3 cards you draw".
would 2(1) cost not upgraded be too weak? The character still has stasis so you aren't losing the cards immediately.
2c draw 3 is kinda dog
just upping the price by one seems fine

Alternatively I think you could do something interesting where the cost stays 0 initially but the packages themselves have a cost attached to them, so you can balance having extremely high value packages (possibly with gems pre-socketed) at the cost of being more expensive
so 1(0) cost or 1 (cards are upgraded)
yeah either of those
just that it should still be playable in unupgraded state
I think with stasis, a card costing a bit more isn't as bad as it is on other characters
this could be cool
See the problem is sometimes you play package for immediate frontload
ie: giga beam
And it completely loses that use case if it's at 2c
Also one thing that could be sick is if some of the packages just had cards from other characters
I think having something like the specialty slimes, where each character has their own package that has 1-2 cards from that character would be really cool.
that would be an interesting card identity but might req a bit of work to get balanced
Yeah I'm just spitballing ideas, I don't think they're all realistic
It does already *kinda* have this but only for the robotic characters (has defect package, tri-sentry package, etc) which I feel like is just as flavorful so maybe this isn't the best idea
0 but you get the cards next turn

To be fair I think the card does need to lose some use cases, as currently it's use case is practically the use case of 9 separate cards at once. The way I proposed just isn't the best way to go about it tbh.
this also sounds good
it's more "there should not be dead packages" tbh
all packages should do something sometimes
maybe some of those things overlap or they may not be the best at those things
but they should at least have a use case
guardian is a well balanced outside of the rares which are all in their top 10% of cards
like the only really bad one is revenge protocol, which is still pretty good and onyx which you can just socket into a card
*Do not diss Onyx.*
onyx is like 0c0d gcf so
it is a bit slow admittedly so it shouldn't be your only scaling
that is not a very good description of it

embeds.title: Good Clean Fight
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 (0) :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 1 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: which is what i was referring to
0 draw is the main thing, 0c0d is just free value zzz
onyx is a fine card in a pool with overpowered cards. Yeah if I won the lottery and got $1000 I'd be happy, but if I saw I had a 50% chance of being a millionaire I'd be a lot less happy

The flexibility this card offers is incredible. There are 7 different packages in the pool, you get to pick 1 out of 3 in each fight, and they all give you 3 cards. The upgrade is a very high priority, upgrading all 3 cards, often giving cost reduction or upgrading powers to make for stronger scaling. 2 of the packages provide strong AOE solutions, 1 gives perma weak though sentry waves, one gives repulsor (which is excellent for act 4, as well as some earlier act bosses, and can feel somewhat awkward to include otherwise), 4 of the packages provide some form of scaling (defect giving you an extra stasis slot), 4 of the packages give frontloaded damage, and just spheric helps to provide frontloaded block. The AOE and frontloading are particularly useful to help solve short fights, and having the scaling options for longer boss fights as well makes this card supremely flexible, and since you get to look at 3 packages to choose from in each fight, your odds of finding what you need are fairly high.

To top all that off, this also basically draws 3 cards for 0 energy, and even counts as two 0 cost skills initially for the likes of stasis engine, floating orbs, ink bottle, and letter opener. Downfall can only try to punish the card spam element of this through watcher 3 and god of life, neither of which do anywhere near enough to stop it. It's really difficult to put into words just how strong this effect is, you are getting a massive amount of output for just drawing 1 card, while spending 0 energy, while also being able to flex it between short, medium, and long fights. Guardian is well known for having an incredibly strong pool of rares, and this definitely stands high even among that competition. I would pick it over just about anything, though I could see situations where I would take body crash  with the right synergies. or stasis engine if I could get is going very quickly.

Heading into act 2 specifically, spheric shield notably provides frontloaded block, and stasis shield provides powerful recurring block, which are difficult options to find from compile package (one package actually has spheric shield in it, another has metallicize). Gem cannon is a thing, but I don't really find it to be very fun, even if taking it over package is likely correct. I think I would basically always buy compile package from a shop when I see it (barring run winning relics, or key potions to get through otherwise deadly fights).

 Notably very good with dead branch, as both it and the package exhaust for 0 energy, and strange spoon can do some very odd things with this, as you might manage to keep either/both of compile and the generated package. There are 7 powers among the packages, , so mummified hand is great to give discounts, and you can select packages with multiple powers as well to heal off of bird faced urn.

Does this need a nerf? Probably, the easiest starting place would be the cost, 0 is a ridiculous amount of energy to pay for this effect. On the other hand, many of the cards created from the packages are expensive, so upping the cost of this too much would hurt your ability to actually use the cards it makes, so I wouldn't want it to cost more than 1. I quite like the balance/variety/robotic theming of the packages right now, so I wouldn't want to add more to the pool. I could see making the generated packages have different costs while keeping compile itself at 0, that would add more knobs to fine tune the power level, though it would also increase the complexity of playing with the card.

Onyx should not be compared to good clean fight/promotion. It has three very major things going for it (and one small drawback) that make it quite different. It's closer to reprogram in my mind, since it doesn't exhaust (and can be used multiple times for scaling, unlike powers) and is in a card pool that can easily get it back to benefit from it more than once per cycle (reroute/recover, sort of like defects hologram/rebound). The downside is that you may not draw onyx alongside a way to gain temp debuffs, so sometimes it doesn't work. The other major upside though is that it can be safely tucked into a socket card, preferably one that guarantees landing at least one temp debuff alongside it, which also means it doesn't have to have the same kind of low impact/airiness/poor tempo of those other scaling cards. The other major thing is that it reduces ALL of your debuffs by 1, including things like vulnerable/frail/weak/ hex(chosen)/confused(snecko), entangled (red slaver), and no block (panic button). That benefit doesn't come up in every fight, but when it does, it can make a huge difference to make difficult fights much cleaner.
onyx is only rare since if it was uncommon it would break the character.
resilent plate is better than oynx
and quartz > oynx
Honestly I don't think it would. I think it would be too strong in the uncommon pool but not character-breaking levels.

Resilient plate is very good, but it's quite different from onyx. You can't socket it into a card to consolidate it's value and guarantee pairing it with debuffs. If you want to loop it, you have to upgrade it to prevent it from exhausting. It does however remove 2 stacks of debuffs, and gives 8 (essentially 10, counting the debuff removal) brace, most of the way towards a defensive mode. Quartz is better in a general sense (pretty much always strong, especially unsocketed) but there are definitely situations where onyx is a more important card to build a scaling engine.
It is just 8, not 10. The debuff removal doesn't count as brace.
